ticketpy package¶

ticketpy.ticketpy module¶

Client/library for Ticketmaster’s Discovery API

class ticketpy.ticketpy.ApiClient(api_key, version='v2', response_type='json')¶

Bases: object

ApiClient for the Ticketmaster Discovery API

Request URLs end up looking like: http://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json?apikey={api_key}

api_key = None¶

Ticketmaster API key

base_url = 'https://app.ticketmaster.com'¶
events_url¶
response_type = None¶

Response type (json, xml...)

url¶

Root URL

venues_url¶
exception ticketpy.ticketpy.ApiException(url, params, response)¶

Bases: Exception

Exception thrown for API-related error messages

class ticketpy.ticketpy.Event(event_id=None, name=None, start_date=None, start_time=None, status=None, genres=None, price_ranges=None, venues=None)¶

Bases: object

Ticketmaster event.

The JSON returned from the Discovery API (at least, as far as what’s being used here) looks like:

{
    "name": "Event name",
    "dates": {
        "start": {
            "localDate": "2019-04-01",
            "localTime": "2019-04-01T23:00:00Z"
        },
        "status": {
            "code": "onsale"
        }
    },
    "classifications": [
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Rock"
            }
        },
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Funk"
            }
        }
    ],
    "priceRanges": [
        {
            "min": 10,
            "max": 25
        }
    ],
    "_embedded": {
        "venues": [
            {
                "name": "The Tabernacle"
            }
        ]
    }
}
static from_json(json_event)¶

Creates an Event from API’s JSON response

Parameters:json_event – Deserialized JSON object from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Event
genres = None¶

List of genre classifications

price_ranges = None¶

Price ranges found for tickets

start_date = None¶

Local start date

start_time = None¶

Start time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

status = None¶

Sale status (such as Cancelled, Offsale...)

venues = None¶

List of ticketpy.Venue objects associated with this event

class ticketpy.ticketpy.PageIterator(api_client, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Iterates through API response pages

all()¶

Return a flat list of results. Automatically paginates.

api_client = None¶

Parent API client

current_page = None¶

Current page number

end_page = None¶

Final page number

limit(limit=50, strict=False)¶

Limit the number of items returned. NOTE: Will go over or under the actual limit depending on strict. Automatically paginates through response.

If strict is False, all items in results pages are added until limit is either met or exceeded.

If strict is True, items are added until the limit is either met, or until the next page size would exceed the limit.

Ex: 5 pages of 20 results each (100 items)

Limit=25, strict=False would return a list of size 40 (the initial page has len==20, so another page is returned)

Limit=25, strict=True would return a list of size 20 (the initial page has len==20, though pulling another would exceed limit)

Parameters:
  • limit – Return (roughly) this number of items
  • strict – False to come as close to limit as possible without falling below. True to come as close as possible to limit without exceeding it.
Returns:

List of items
next()¶
page = None¶

Current page

start_page = None¶

Initial page number

class ticketpy.ticketpy.Venue(name=None, address=None, city=None, state_code=None, postal_code=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, markets=None, url=None, box_office_info=None, dmas=None, general_info=None, venue_id=None, social=None, timezone=None, images=None, parking_detail=None, accessible_seating_detail=None)¶

Bases: object

A Ticketmaster venue

The JSON returned from the Discovery API looks something like this (edited for brevity):

{
    "id": "KovZpaFEZe",
    "name": "The Tabernacle",
    "url": "http://www.ticketmaster.com/venue/115031",
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "address": {
        "line1": "152 Luckie Street"
    },
    "city": {
        "name": "Atlanta"
    },
    "postalCode": "30303",
    "state": {
        "stateCode": "GA",
        "name": "Georgia"
    },
    "country": {
        "name": "United States Of America",
        "countryCode": "US"
    },
    "location": {
        "latitude": "33.758688",
        "longitude": "-84.391449"
    },
    "social": {
        "twitter": {
            "handle": "@TabernacleATL"
        }
    },
    "markets": [
        {
            "id": "10"
        }
    ]
}
address = None¶

Street address (first line)

city = None¶

City name

Create a Venue object from the API response’s JSON data

Parameters:json_venue – Deserialized JSON from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Venue

Latitude

Longitude

markets = None¶

List of market IDs

Venue’s name

parking_detail = None¶

Parking details

postal_code = None¶

Zip/postal code

social = None¶

Social media links (Twitter, etc)

state_code = None¶

State code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)

timezone = None¶

Timezone venue’s located in

url = None¶

Ticketmaster internal venue URL

venue_id = None¶

Venue ID (use to look up events)
